newsitem.title: UK: INSIGHT - Pressure on downside for gold, silver.
newsitem.headline: INSIGHT - Pressure on downside for gold, silver.

text.p: SPOT NY CLOSE * SUPPORT * RESIST * RSI14 * MA10 * MA30
-----------------VIEWS FROM THE MARKET - April 15--------------
Gold is seen probing key $345 support, but analysts were divided on whether it would bounce or break through the important floor, which could send it slipping further.
Silver was also feeling downside pressure and could test support at $4.65.
GOLD -
The market remained under pressure, with spot gold edging down to a fresh low bid of $345.20 in early activity on Tuesday.
"The $345 area is critical support, but I think it will bounce," said technical analyst Karen Jones of Credit Suisse First Boston.
"But rallies need to get above $350 to make any impression at all on what can only be described as a dense wall of resistance," she added.
Others, though, including analyst Martin Squires of broker Rudolf Wolff believed that gold had lower to go.
"A descending triangle is developing...suggesting further downside movements can be expected," he said, referring to the April Comex contract.
"The technical indicators are weakening, in confirmation of further downside tests," he said, adding that players should wait for a confirmed breakout before taking up a position.
Most analysts agreed that a breach of $345 would trigger stops and send prices down to $340, and then possibly to February's lows of $336.15.
At 0845 GMT spot gold was quoted at $345.60/345.90, down about 40 cents from Monday's New York close.
SILVER -
The market is likely to consolidate with a downward bias, as indicators continue to show the market is oversold.
The 14-day RSI dipped to 27.0 early on Tuesday from 27.5 on Monday and 28.0 on Friday.
Nearby support was pegged at Friday's low of $4.70, with further support seen at the April 3 nadir of $4.65.
"We have very good support around $4.62, the support we saw at the beginning of the year. I think we can see the market bounce from this area," said Jones.
A break of $4.60/$4.62 would herald a dive all the way to $4.33, the lows of $1995, she added.
Resistance was pegged at $4.80, and then $4.84, a breach of which would be needed to move higher.
At 0845 GMT spot silver was quoted at $4.71/4.73, down one cent from Monday's New York close.
PLATINUM -
The market would stay within its wide $360-$375 range for the time being, with pressure sending it to the bottom of the price band.
At 0845 GMT spot platinum was quoted at $365.25/366.25, down $1.45 from Monday's New York close.
